Dear Sheffield City Council,
Under the Freedom of Information Act 2000, I kindly request information regarding the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Content Management System (CMS) platforms used by your council.
1. CRM Platform Information:
a. What CRM platform does your council currently use?
b. When is the contract end date for the CRM platform?
c. When was the CRM contract last re-tendered?
d. Could you please provide the contract value for the CRM platform? (Please note that invoices exceeding £5,000 are required to be accessible to the public.)
e. Is there an intent to release a tender for CRM platforms in the foreseeable future? If so, kindly provide an estimated timeline or relevant details.
2. CMS Platform Information:
a. What CMS platform does your council currently use?
b. When is the contract end date for the CMS platform?
c. When was the CMS contract last re-tendered?
d. Could you please provide the contract value for the CMS platform? (Please note that invoices exceeding £5,000 are required to be accessible to the public.)
e. Is there an intent to release a tender for CMS platforms in the foreseeable future? If so, kindly provide an estimated timeline or relevant details.
I understand that under the Freedom of Information Act, you are required to respond within 20 working days. If some of the requested information is exempt from disclosure, please provide an explanation for the exemptions.
If any of the requested information is not readily available, I would appreciate your guidance on the steps I can take to obtain the necessary data.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response.
Yours faithfully,
Phil Turner

Dear Phil Turner,

Dear Phil Turner,
Thank you for your request for information relating to CRM and CMS
Platform which we received on 07/09/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. CRM Platform Information:
a. What CRM platform does your council currently use?
Lagan – Supplier is Verint via Boxxe
b. When is the contract end date for the CRM platform?
28 June 2024
c. When was the CRM contract last re-tendered?
2021
d. Could you please provide the contract value for the CRM platform?
£1.37m (Please note that invoices exceeding £5,000 are required to be
accessible to the public.) e. Is there an intent to release a tender for
CRM platforms in the foreseeable future? If so, kindly provide an
estimated timeline or relevant details.   Procurement strategy currently
being finalised, may be via a public sector framework call-off
2. CMS Platform Information:
a. What CMS platform does your council currently use?
Drupal
b. When is the contract end date for the CMS platform?
31 August 2024, with option to extend to 31 August 2025
c. When was the CMS contract last re-tendered?
2021
d. Could you please provide the contract value for the CMS platform?
(Please note that invoices exceeding £5,000 are required to be accessible
to the public.)e. Is there an intent to release a tender for CMS platforms
in the foreseeable future? If so, kindly provide an estimated timeline or
relevant details.
£193,400 (inc. options to extend if all taken) contract value; we don’t
intend to release a tender for CMS platforms in the foreseeable future.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
